reviews.review:
On its own merits, this movie is an impressive balancing act that doesn't sacrifice genuine emotion and drama under the weight of its massive cast and budget.

As part of a larger universe, it feels like a wasted opportunity to propel the MCU into a new generation.

The best movie in MCU to date. This movie had an extreme amount of hype behind it and it definitely delivered and some. The story was great and wasn't afraid to end where it did, the pacing of the movie was perfect, and the characters were well balanced. Everyone had just the right amount of screen time they needed and they were divided into the right groups. Thanos was played excellent and instead of being a mindless brute of destruction typical of most movies nowadays, you really empathize with him. Overall excellent movie!

La mejor película de superhéroes de todos los tiempos.
El mejor villano desde Darth Vader.  Una película en la que han desembocado 10 años de otras películas a la perfección. 
Muy recomendable.

Avengers: Infinity War is a good time. It has a little too much humor for the end of half of the universe, that's the only complaint that I personally have.
Avengers: Infinity War is THANOS'S movie. This is his time to shine. He is here, and he is here to wreak havoc on the Avengers and their allies.
Even with the massive amount of hype for this film, it mostly lives up to the massive amount of hype.
Emotional and funny, all these superheroes, it was  the best movie I've seen this year so far
Wow, just so well made and lived up to the massive hype
incredible action and effects, 10/10 on the Thanos performance. Suprising and interesting ending. Brilliant film.

After 10 years and 18 movies, Marvel has started the beginning of the end with Avengers: Infinity War. In order to truly appreciate the decade of work that has gone into this massive undertaking, I strongly recommend seeing every film before stepping foot in the theater. Not only does this help on a surface-level of understanding plot threads and character arcs, but it dives super deep of an emotional ocean that mostly series fans will be able to share. And if you haven't seen anything before Infinity War? Buckle up. This is leaps and bounds beyond anything you've seen on a superhero scale.

Infinity War is for the fans, and they will love it.

Generally, the MCU films are well made, though often cookie-cutter and with few risks taken. Why fix what isn't broken, right? Yet this films takes its characters, the soul of Marvel films, and breaks them, or worse, kills them outright. Those who bear witness feel the consequences. This includes Thanos, who has my vote for the most humanized and interesting villain in the MCU.

It's not even a proper "film." Citing Ralph Sepe Jr., it's an "event." The cinematic equivalent of an amusement park presentation, except the characters we've come to know for nearly a decade are truly challenged.

There is a weight that feels more real than prior conflicts, and watching characters rationalize their innate fear gives greater depth to someone like Thor, who over the years was characterized as simply stoic, arrogant, and more recently, charmingly goofy.

Funny enough, the weakest part of Infinity War for me is its humor. Not always bad, but often poorly timed and forced into scenes I wish they weren't.

If you're not big on Marvel, it's a good action spectacle, but you won't gain much in character development, since it heavily requires the other films for that. It also suffers from some pacing issues, which is almost inevitable considering the scale. Despite that, it doesn't feel at all like a mess.

If you are another Marvel shill like me...do enjoy. 
It's one hell of an event.

Marvel Fans - 9 / 10
Non-Marvel - 7.5 / 10
